intro: Adonis autumnalis, commonly known as autumnal adonis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant produces striking yellow flowers in late summer to early autumn, typically from August to October. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Adonis autumnalis is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
